src_text: Jako NSA pōmogoł Carterowi w dyplōmatycznym załatwianiu światowych spraw, takich jak ugody z Camp David, 1978; normalizacyjo relacyji amerykańsko-chińskich pod kōniec lot 70.; rewolucyjo irańsko, co dokludziyła do kryzysu z zakładnikami w Iranie, 1979; i najozd sowiecki w Afganistanie, 1979.
ref_text: As NSA, he assisted Carter in diplomatically handling world affairs, such as the Camp David Accords, 1978; normalizing US–China relations thought the late 1970s; the Iranian Revolution, which led to the Iran hostage crisis, 1979; and the Soviet invasion in Afghanistan, 1979.
hyp_text: As NSA, Brzezinski assisted Carter in the formulation of the Carter Doctrine, which declared that the United States would use military force if necessary to defend its national interests in the Persian Gulf region.[24] Brzezinski encouraged Carter to engage the People's Republic of China and traveled to Beijing to lay the groundwork for the normalization of relations between the two countries. This also resulted in the severing of ties with the United States' longtime anti-Communist ally the Republic of China (Taiwan).[25] In the 1978 Camp David talks, President Carter, Israeli Prime Minister Menachem Begin, and Egyptian President Anwar Sadat concluded the Camp David Accords. The September 17, 1978, agreement ended the state of war between Israel and Egypt, and led directly to the March 26, 1979, Israel-Egypt Peace Treaty. Brzezinski had a prominent role in the construction of the Accords.[26] In the Joint Statement of the Governments of United States and Egypt, President Carter publicly expressed his "appreciation to President Sadat for the leading role he has played in developing a comprehensive peace plan which, as we understand it, provides for the full exercise of Egyptian sovereignty over the Sinai." After the Accords, Egypt began the process of normalizing relations with Israel.
